tweets.author: SlerfTools

tweets.content:
Bundle transactions on BSC combine liquidity creation and buy operations into a single atomic transaction submitted to the blockchain, effectively reducing the risk of MEV bot sniping during token launches.

In traditional token launches, developers typically add liquidity on PancakeSwap first, followed by user purchases. However, MEV bots can monitor the mempool, front-run the liquidity addition by buying at a low price, and profit when the price rises. Bundle transactions ensure these steps occur simultaneously, preventing bots from intervening. This protects the fairness of the launch for project teams, avoids early price manipulation, and reduces slippage and high costs for investors due to front-running.

SlerfTools enhances this process by offering a solution for creating liquidity and enabling simultaneous buys from over 100 addresses, improving efficiency and security.
